metadata.name: Greedy File Deletion Using Del
metadata.comment: Detects execution of the "del" builtin command to remove files using greedy/wildcard expression. This is often used by malware to delete content of folders that perhaps contains the initial malware infection or to delete evidence.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('cmd.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('del ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('erase '))) AND (lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*\\.*\.au3.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*\\.*\.dll.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*\\.*\.exe.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*\\.*\.js.*'))

output.summary: Detects execution of the "del" builtin command to remove files using greedy/wildcard expression. This is often used by malware to delete content of folders that perhaps contains the initial malware infection or to delete evidence.
